title: Algorithms - MODERATE Level
description: üå≤ Expand your algorithmic toolkit! This quiz focuses on intermediate topics: **Divide and Conquer** techniques, the use of **recursion** üîÅ, comparative $\mathbf{sorting \, performance}$, and core **graph algorithms** üß≠. (20 Questions - 40 Minutes)

questions.text: What is the **time complexity** of **Merge Sort** in the worst case?
Which algorithm is used to find the **shortest path** in a weighted graph without negative edges?
Which data structure is used to implement $\mathbf{Depth \, First \, Search \, (DFS)}$?
The $\mathbf{Recurrence \, Relation}$ $T(n) = 2T(n/2) + O(n)$ is characteristic of which algorithm?
Which sorting algorithm is **unstable** in its typical implementation?
The technique of breaking a problem into smaller subproblems, solving them, and combining the results is called...
What is the key process in $\mathbf{Quick \, Sort}$?

options.b: Partitioning the array around a pivot element

questions.text: Which $\mathbf{graph \, traversal \, algorithm}$ guarantees finding the shortest path in an unweighted graph?
The $\mathbf{Master \, Theorem}$ is used to solve...

options.b: Recurrence relations for divide and conquer algorithms

questions.text: In $\mathbf{Prim's \, Algorithm}$, the goal is to find the...
The technique of using a $\mathbf{hash \, table}$ to check for duplicate subproblem solutions in recursion is called...
The $\mathbf{Average \, Case \, complexity}$ of Quick Sort is...
A **recursive algorithm** must always have a defined...
Which sorting algorithm's worst-case time complexity is $O(n \log n)$ but is typically slower than Quick Sort in practice due to higher constant factors?
The complexity $O(n^2)$ is considered what kind of growth rate?
Which algorithm is based on the $\mathbf{Greedy}$ technique for finding the Minimum Spanning Tree (MST)?
What does a $\mathbf{strongly \, connected \, component}$ imply in a directed graph?

options.a: All vertices are connected by a path
options.b: Every vertex is reachable from every other vertex in the component

questions.text: The $\mathbf{Worst \, Case \, complexity}$ of Quick Sort occurs when the pivot selection leads to partitions that are...
What is the primary characteristic of a $\mathbf{Complete \, Graph}$?

options.b: Every pair of distinct vertices is connected by a unique edge

questions.text: In a $\mathbf{Counting \, Sort}$ algorithm, which assumption must be true about the input elements?

options.c: They must be integers within a small, known range
